messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What is the next open house at the University of New Haven?
The next open house is the Henry C. Lee Open House for the College of Criminal Justice & Forensic Sciences, which will be held on November 3rd at 10:00 AM at the University of New Haven.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I bring guests to the open house?
Yes, students attending the open house can bring up to two guests, for a total of three people per party.
You are a helpful assistant.
When is the next general Fall Open House?
The next general Fall Open House will be held on November 17th at 10:00 AM at the University of New Haven. Another Fall Open House is scheduled for December 8th.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens during an undergraduate open house at the University of New Haven?

During an undergraduate open house, you'll get to learn about student and residential life, hear from faculty members in your academic area of interest, and take a campus tour. It's a great way to get to know the University of New Haven.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I attend the open house virtually?
Yes, the University of New Haven offers both on-campus and virtual open house options. Attending virtually is a great way to become familiar with the university if you can’t make it in person
You are a helpful assistant.
How many programs and student organizations does the University of New Haven have?
The University of New Haven offers over 100 programs of study and more than 150 student clubs and organizations, ensuring there's something for everyone.
You are a helpful assistant.
Where can I register for the open house?
You can register for the open house by visiting the University of New Haven’s website and navigating to the undergraduate admissions section where you can find registration links for upcoming events.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Henry C. Lee Open House?

The Henry C. Lee Open House is a special event for students interested in the College of Criminal Justice & Forensic Sciences at the University of New Haven. It will take place on November 3rd at 10:00 AM.
You are a helpful assistant.
What time does the open house start?
The open houses at the University of New Haven typically start at 10:00 AM.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will I learn at the open house?
At the open house, you'll have the chance to learn about student life, residential life, and your academic area of interest. You'll also take a tour of the campus and meet faculty members.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the admissions information sessions at the University of New Haven?

Admissions Information Sessions and Campus Tours are designed for families starting the college search process. You will meet with a member of the admissions staff to learn about the exciting programs and opportunities the University of New Haven offers. This is followed by a full campus tour led by a current student.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long is the admissions information session?
The Information Session and Campus Tour will last approximately 2 hours.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I bring guests to the campus tour?
Yes, students attending events are asked to limit their guests to two people, making a total of three attendees.
You are a helpful assistant.
When are the upcoming information sessions?
The upcoming information sessions and campus tours are scheduled for October 21st, 22nd, 23rd, 24th, 28th, and 29th. You can check availability and register through the university's website.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I contact the admissions office?

You can contact the Office of Undergraduate Admissions by phone at (203) 932-7319 or by email at Admissions@newhaven.edu. The office is located at Anemone & Steven Kaplan Hall, 300 Boston Post Rd, West Haven, CT 06516-1916.
You are a helpful assistant.
Where is the University of New Haven located?
The University of New Haven is located at 300 Boston Post Rd, West Haven, CT 06516.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are group information sessions at the University of New Haven?

Group Information Sessions and Tours are customized visits hosted for high school, community college, and school counselor groups. These sessions include an Information Session with an admissions representative and a campus tour with a Charger Ambassador.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can we attend a group information session on weekends?
Group Information Sessions and Tours are hosted on select weekdays. Unfortunately, the University of New Haven does not host group visits on weekends.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can group tours be hosted virtually?
Yes, Group Information Sessions and Tours can be hosted either virtually or on-campus and are customizable to meet the needs of your group.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I arrange a group visit to the University of New Haven?
Group visits are by invite only. For more information or to schedule a group visit, please email mfleischer@newhaven.edu.
You are a helpful assistant.
What does a group tour include?
A Group Information Session includes a meeting with one of the University of New Haven's admissions representatives followed by a campus tour led by one of the Charger Ambassadors.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do I contact the admissions office?

You can contact the Office of Undergraduate Admissions by phone at (203) 932-7319 or by email at Admissions@newhaven.edu. The office is located at Anemone & Steven Kaplan Hall, 300 Boston Post Rd, West Haven, CT 06516.
You are a helpful assistant.
Where do I go for parking and check-in at the University of New Haven?

Staff members or student ambassadors will be outside to assist you with parking and direct you to check-in. For most admissions events, use Google Maps to navigate to Anemone and Steven Kaplan Hall at 300 Boston Post Road, West Haven, CT 06516. The admissions building will be the first on the right as you enter.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long is the Information Session and Campus Tour?
The total event lasts about 2 hours: 30 minutes for the Information Session and approximately 60-75 minutes for the walking tour.
You are a helpful assistant.
What should I do if I am running late for the campus tour?
Please let us know by calling or texting (477) 224-2141, or emailing admissions@newhaven.edu. We will be happy to assist you with check-in once you arrive.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I get a school absence note for my visit?
Yes, if your visit is during a school day, an admissions staff member can assist you with getting an absence note.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I bring an additional guest to the campus tour?

We ask that you limit the number of guests to two people, making a total of three in your party. However, if you have a younger sibling or family member who cannot stay at home, they are welcome to attend.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I reschedule my visit to the University of New Haven?
Yes, you can reschedule your visit by canceling it through the Registration Form linked in your confirmation email. To reschedule for an upcoming event, visit: newhaven.edu/visit.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the application deadlines for first-year students for Fall 2025?

The application deadlines are as followsEarly Decision: December 1 (Binding),Early Action I: December 15 (Non-Binding),Early Action II: February 15 (Non-Binding),Regular Decision: Rolling (Non-Binding), with a priority deadline of March 1.
You are a helpful assistant.
What does a binding admission decision mean?
A binding admission decision means that the University of New Haven is your first choice. Upon acceptance, you are committed to enroll at the university.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is Early Action at the University of New Haven?
Early Action means that the University of New Haven is one of your top choices. You will receive your admissions decision early, but you do not have to commit until the normal reply date of May 1.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the benefits of applying Early Decision or Early Action?

Students admitted under Early Decision or Early Action will receive a guaranteed minimum of $18,000 in annual merit scholarships, priority consideration for enrollment into top choice programs, early notification of admission, and more opportunities to attend exclusive accepted student events.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does it take to receive an admission decision after applying?
Students can expect to receive a decision on their completed application within 4-6 weeks after submission.
You are a helpful assistant.
What materials are required for first-year applicants?

First-year applicants must submit the following:Common Application or UNewHaven Application,$50 application fee,Official high school transcript (unofficial acceptable to complete the application),Essay (250-650 words),Optional: Letter of recommendation,SAT or ACT scores (if required by the program).
You are a helpful assistant.
What do homeschooled applicants need to submit?

Homeschooled applicants must submit SAT or ACT scores, detailed documentation of their academic curriculum, and proof of secondary school completion, such as a final transcript with a graduation date or a high school equivalency diploma.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I reschedule my campus visit?
Yes, you can reschedule your visit by canceling it through the Registration Form linked in your confirmation email. To reschedule, visit newhaven.edu/visit.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I submit my application materials to the University of New Haven?

Application materials can be submitted by uploading them to the Application Portal, emailing them to admissions@newhaven.edu, electronic submission by school counselors (via Naviance, Slate.org, Scoir), or mailing them to the Office of Undergraduate Admissions.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is Niche Direct Admission at the University of New Haven?

Niche Direct Admission is a new way to apply for college. High school seniors with a Niche profile may see an offer for conditional direct admission from the University of New Haven in their Niche account.
You are a helpful assistant.
When can transfer students apply to the University of New Haven?

Transfer students can apply at any time throughout the year, as the University of New Haven reviews applications on a rolling basis. We accept applications for both the spring semester, which begins in late January, and the fall semester, which begins in late August.
You are a helpful assistant.
When should I apply as a transfer student?

It is recommended that transfer students apply as early as possible, as space in some academic programs fills up quickly. Applications for the following year typically begin being reviewed on September 1st.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does it take to receive an admission decision as a transfer student?
You can expect to receive a decision on your transfer application within 1-2 weeks once your application is complete and all required materials have been submitted.
You are a helpful assistant.
What materials are required for transfer applicants?

Transfer applicants must submit the following:The University of New Haven Online Transfer Application,Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended,A copy of your high school diploma or official high school transcript,A 250-500 word written statement/essay detailing why you wish to pursue an education at the University of New Haven,Complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) as soon as possible.
You are a helpful assistant.
What special requirements do I need to meet for the BS in Paramedicine program?
For the BS in Paramedicine Online program, you must hold an NREMT-P License as part of the application requirements.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is required for the Dental Hygiene program for transfer students?
Applicants to the Dental Hygiene program must submit one letter of recommendation as part of the application process.
You are a helpful assistant.
What materials are required for transfer students applying to Graphic and Digital Design?
Transfer students applying to the Graphic and Digital Design program must submit a portfolio of their previous college work along with the general transfer application materials
You are a helpful assistant.
Who can I contact about transfer admissions at the University of New Haven?

For transfer admissions, you can contact your admissions counselor:Last names A-K: Contact Brittney Duntz at (203) 815-8742 or BDuntz@newhaven.edu.,Last names L-Z: Contact Lizzy Locke at (203) 641-0719 or ELocke@newhaven.edu. If you have trouble reaching a Transfer Enrollment Counselor, you can email admissions@newhaven.edu.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I apply as an Undeclared student as a transfer applicant?
es, transfer students have the option of applying directly to their major of choice or applying as an Undeclared (Exploratory) student
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens after I am accepted as a transfer student?
Once you are accepted, the University of New Haven will work on a transfer credit evaluation to show you how your credits will be applied to your degree program.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the admission requirements for international undergraduate first-year students at the University of New Haven?

International undergraduate first-year applicants must submit:A complete online application or apply via the Common Application.,Certified copies of high school records (transcripts, diplomas, etc.).,An explanation of the high school grading system.,A letter of recommendation from an academic source.,A personal essay (250-650 words).,English proficiency scores (TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, SAT/ACT) if English is not the official language of the applicant’s country.
You are a helpful assistant.
Do international applicants need to submit test scores to the University of New Haven?

The University of New Haven does not require test scores for most academic programs. However, if English is not the official language in your country, you must submit TOEFL, PTE, IELTS, Duolingo, SAT, or ACT scores.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the priority deadline for international undergraduate applications?
The priority deadlines are:June 1st for the fall semester.,November 1st for the spring semester.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the required documents for international undergraduate transfer students?

International undergraduate transfer students must submit:A completed online application.,Official post-secondary school transcripts.,High school transcripts and diploma.,A letter of recommendation from an academic source.,A personal essay (250-650 words).,English proficiency scores if fewer than 12 credits have been completed at a U.S. institution.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I submit my documents to the University of New Haven?

You can email your documents to IntUGAdm@newhaven.edu or mail them to: Office of International Undergraduate Admissions, University of New Haven, 300 Boston Post Road, West Haven, CT 06516. We recommend using a special courier such as FedEx, DHL, or UPS.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the English language requirements for international students at the University of New Haven?

Non-native English speakers must submit one of the following scores:IELTS: 6.0,TOEFL: 75,SAT: 450 Evidence-Based Reading and Writing Score,Pearson Test of English: 53,Duolingo: 105 Alternatively, students can complete the AEPP Advanced Level 4 (English for Academic Purposes) certificate.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is Conditional Admission at the University of New Haven?

Conditional Admission is granted to international students who meet all academic requirements except the English language requirement. Once they meet the language and financial requirements, they will receive a University of New Haven I-20 and be allowed to enroll. Students may opt to enroll in the Academic English Preparatory Program (AEPP) to improve their English skills before starting academic classes.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Academic English Preparatory Program at the University of New Haven?

The Academic English Preparatory Program (AEPP) is a comprehensive program designed to prepare international students for undergraduate or graduate studies. It focuses on academic English skills in listening, reading, speaking, writing, and adjusting to American culture. The program is tailored to each student’s major and lasts 4 months per term.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I evaluate my international transcripts for admission to the University of New Haven?

International transcripts that are not in English must be accompanied by a certified evaluation from one of the following agencies:World Education Services,Educational Credential Evaluators,SpanTran Education Services.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the deadline for spring applications for international students?
The priority deadline for spring applications is November 1st.
You are a helpful assistant.
Is the University of New Haven test optional?
Yes, the University of New Haven is a test optional institution. Many programs and populations can choose whether or not to have their SAT or ACT scores considered for admission
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the University of New Haven's 'Do No Harm' policy?

The 'Do No Harm' policy means that if SAT or ACT scores are not required for your program, the University will only use submitted scores if they have a positive impact on your admissions decision or merit scholarship. If the scores would negatively impact your chance of admission or scholarship, they will automatically be excluded during the review process.
You are a helpful assistant.
Are there any programs that require SAT or ACT scores for admission?
For the Spring 2025 and Fall 2025 terms, the University of New Haven is not requiring SAT or ACT scores for admission into any specific academic programs.
You are a helpful assistant.
Which applicants are still required to submit test scores?

Home-schooled students, online school applicants, and high school equivalency applicants are still required to submit SAT or ACT scores. Additionally, students from countries where English is not the official language must submit a standardized exam such as TOEFL, IELTS, SAT, or ACT.
You are a helpful assistant.
Does being test optional affect scholarship eligibility at the University of New Haven?

No, all applicants for full-time admission are automatically considered for merit scholarships even if they do not submit SAT or ACT scores. Merit scholarship awards range from $15,000 to $32,000 annually.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do I choose whether to submit my SAT/ACT scores?

When applying through the Common Application or UNewHaven Application, you will be asked if you would like your SAT or ACT scores considered. You can select 'Consider my SAT and/or ACT results' or 'Do not consider my SAT and/or ACT results'. If you choose the wrong option, you can email admissions@newhaven.edu to update your application.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do I contact the admissions office at the University of New Haven?

You can contact the Office of Undergraduate Admissions by phone at (203) 932-7319 or by email at admissions@newhaven.edu. The office is located at Anemone and Steven Kaplan Hall, 300 Boston Post Rd., West Haven, CT 06516.
You are a helpful assistant.
Does the test optional policy apply to international students?
Yes, international students are test optional. However, if English is not the official language in your country, you must submit one of the following: TOEFL, IELTS, SAT, or ACT.
You are a helpful assistant.
What merit scholarship opportunities are available at the University of New Haven?

Merit scholarships range from $15,000 to $32,000 annually, and 97% of University of New Haven students receive some form of need-based aid. All applicants for full-time admission are considered for scholarships, even if they do not submit SAT or ACT scores.
You are a helpful assistant.
What types of financial aid are available at the University of New Haven?

The University of New Haven offers a comprehensive financial aid program that includes grants, scholarships, student loans, and part-time employment. Funds are available from federal and state governments, private sponsors, and university resources.
You are a helpful assistant.
What percentage of students receive financial aid at the University of New Haven?
More than 95 percent of the University’s full-time undergraduate students receive some form of financial assistance.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I contact the financial aid office?

You can contact the Financial Aid Office at Bergami Hall by phone at (203) 932-7315, by fax at (203) 931-6050, or by email at financialaid@newhaven.edu. Office hours are Monday and Wednesday from 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m., and Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do I apply for financial aid at the University of New Haven?

To apply for financial aid, you need to submit the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Learn more about the application process, eligibility requirements, and financial aid programs on our website.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the 2024-25 FAFSA update?
For important information about the 2024-25 FAFSA form and its availability, follow the link provided on our Financial Aid webpage..
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the payment options available at the University of New Haven?

The University offers various payment options to help students cover tuition and fees. These include federal student loans, Federal Direct Parent Loans (PLUS), private student loans, and payment plans.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I estimate my financial aid at the University of New Haven?
Prospective students can estimate their financial aid using the Net Price Calculator available on the University’s Financial Aid webpage.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the policy on Satisfactory Academic Progress for financial aid?

To maintain eligibility for financial aid, students must meet the Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) requirements, which include maintaining a minimum GPA and completing a certain percentage of attempted coursework.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can I work part-time while studying at the University of New Haven?
Yes, the University of New Haven offers part-time employment opportunities as part of the financial aid program to help students offset the cost of their education.
You are a helpful assistant.
What financial aid options are available for corporate employees or public safety personnel?
The University of New Haven offers tuition discounts for employees of certain corporations, public safety personnel, and other entities. More information is available on the Financial Aid webpage.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the estimated cost of attendance for a full-time undergraduate student living on campus at the University of New Haven?

For the 2024-2025 academic year, the estimated cost of attendance for a full-time undergraduate student living on campus is $70,700. This includes $47,332 for tuition and fees, and $19,808 for food and housing.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the estimated costs for a commuter student at the University of New Haven?

For a full-time undergraduate student commuting from home, the estimated cost of attendance is $55,812. This includes $47,332 for tuition and fees, and additional indirect expenses for books, transportation, and living expenses.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the pre-enrollment fees for new students at the University of New Haven?

The pre-enrollment fees for new students include a $50 application fee, a $300 enrollment fee for both residential and commuter students, and a $200 housing deposit for first-year and transfer residential students.
You are a helpful assistant.
How much does it cost for full-time tuition at the University of New Haven for the 2024-2025 academic year?
For full-time undergraduate students (12-17 credit hours), the yearly tuition is $45,644, or $22,822 per term.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the additional fees for credits over 17 at the University of New Haven?
If you take more than 17 credit hours, there is an additional charge of $1,520 per credit hour.
You are a helpful assistant.
What meal plans are available for undergraduate students?

The University offers several meal plans, including:Charger Pride Meal Plan: $3,464 per term ($6,928 per year),Charger Gold Meal Plan: $3,336 per term ($6,672 per year),Charger Blue Meal Plan: $2,955 per term ($5,910 per year),Senior Meal Plan: $1,926 per term ($3,852 per year),Other smaller plans like Green Plate, Gold Plate, and Blue Plate are also available.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the housing charges for residence halls at the University of New Haven?

Housing charges vary by residence hall. For example:Standard Room: $6,058 per term ($12,116 per year),Celentano Hall (Single Occupancy): $7,249 per term ($14,498 per year),The Atwood 2-Bedroom: $8,740 per term ($17,480 per year).
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the tuition costs for part-time undergraduate students?
For part-time students (1-11 credit hours), the tuition is $1,520 per credit hour, and there is a part-time general fee of $155 per term.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the cost for studying abroad at the Tuscany Campus in Prato, Italy?

For the Tuscany Campus study abroad program, the comprehensive fee per semester is $33,305. This includes $22,822 for tuition, $844 for the general fee, $6,058 for room, $3,336 for meals, and other miscellaneous fees.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the additional fees for certain programs at the University of New Haven?

Additional fees may apply for specific courses and programs. For example, engineering, computer science, and chemistry courses each carry a tuition differential of $80 per credit hour. Lab fees may also apply to certain courses and range from $25 to $5,000.
You are a helpful assistant.
What merit scholarships are available to first-time students at the University of New Haven?

First-time students are automatically considered for merit-based scholarships ranging from $15,000 to $32,000 per academic year. The amount varies based on the student's high school performance and is renewable for up to ten semesters, provided the student maintains the required cumulative GPA.
You are a helpful assistant.
Are transfer students eligible for merit scholarships?

Yes, transfer students can receive the Transfer Scholar Award, which ranges from $15,000 to $32,000 per year based on their GPA. Transfer students with fewer than 12 credit hours will be evaluated for first-year merit scholarships.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship?

The Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship is a $2,000 award available to students who have been inducted into the Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society. This award can be combined with the Transfer Scholar Award and is renewable each year, provided the student maintains a 3.0 GPA.
You are a helpful assistant.
Is there an additional scholarship for students in the University’s Honors Program?
Yes, students accepted into the University of New Haven’s Honors Program may receive an additional $1,000 Honors Scholarship, which is renewable as long as they maintain the program’s requirements.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I apply for the Marching Band Scholarship at the University of New Haven?

To apply for the Marching Band Scholarship, you must express your interest by March 1st of your senior year in high school by filling out the Marching Band interest form or emailing the director of bands, Jason DeGroff, at jdegroff@newhaven.edu. The scholarship amount ranges from $1,000 to $3,000.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Pompea Scholarship?

The Pompea Scholarship is a $3,000 award for full-time students enrolled in the Pompea College of Business. It is renewable for up to ten semesters, provided the student remains in good academic standing.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the Portfolio Scholarship at the University of New Haven?

The Portfolio Scholarship is available to students applying to Art & Design and Music programs. It ranges from $1,000 to $4,000 and can be combined with other merit-based awards, provided the student remains a full-time student in good academic standing.
You are a helpful assistant.
Can merit scholarships be combined with other financial aid at the University of New Haven?

Yes, students receiving merit scholarships can also apply for traditional need-based financial aid programs. However, merit scholarships cannot be combined with tuition exchange, tuition benefits, or tuition remission programs.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are the requirements for maintaining merit scholarships at the University of New Haven?
Merit scholarships are renewable for up to ten semesters, provided the student remains a full-time undergraduate and maintains the required minimum cumulative GPA set by the scholarship.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do high school partnerships affect scholarships at the University of New Haven?

The University has established partnerships with several high schools and organizations that include special scholarship opportunities for admitted, first-time students. These partnership scholarships cannot be combined with traditional merit scholarships.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is a private scholarship?

A private scholarship, also known as an outside scholarship, is awarded by sources outside the University of New Haven. Students can apply for these scholarships from businesses, organizations, civic groups, high schools, religious organizations, and other agencies.
You are a helpful assistant.
How can I find private scholarships?

To find private scholarships, students can:Contact their high school guidance counselor for opportunities.,Check with community service organizations, religious groups, or civic groups.,Ask their parents to check if their employer or union offers scholarships.,Search for scholarships online using trusted websites
You are a helpful assistant.
What should I be aware of to avoid scholarship scams?

To avoid scholarship scams, keep these tips in mind:You should never have to pay to apply for scholarships.,No service can guarantee that you will get money.,Be cautious if a service claims to do all the work for you.,Scholarships should not require your credit card or bank account information.
You are a helpful assistant.
What should I do if I receive a private scholarship?

If you are awarded a private scholarship, you should send a copy of the award notification to the University of New Haven’s Financial Aid Office. This information helps determine whether any adjustments to your current financial aid package are necessary
You are a helpful assistant.
Can private scholarships affect my financial aid?

es, private scholarships can affect your eligibility for other financial aid programs. Once you inform the Financial Aid Office of your private scholarship, they will review and adjust your financial aid package as necessary.
You are a helpful assistant.
What types of scholarships are considered outside scholarships?

Outside scholarships include those awarded by external agencies such as businesses, civic groups, or religious organizations. However, they do not include tuition exchange scholarships, tuition remission benefits, ROTC, or Vocational Rehabilitation benefits.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do outside scholarships affect merit scholarships at the University of New Haven?

Private scholarships that are specifically designated for tuition costs will be substituted dollar for dollar from the university's merit scholarships, as both are applied directly to institutional tuition.
You are a helpful assistant.
What should I do if I think I’ve encountered a scholarship scam?

If you suspect a scholarship opportunity is a scam, avoid providing personal information or paying any fees. Be cautious if a service asks for bank details or guarantees a scholarship without requiring an application.
You are a helpful assistant.
What are examples of organizations that might offer private scholarships?
Examples of organizations that offer private scholarships include high schools, community service organizations, businesses, religious groups, and unions.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do I report an outside scholarship to the Financial Aid Office?
Once you receive a private scholarship, forward the award information to the Financial Aid Office so that any necessary adjustments can be made to your financial aid package.
